comments:
To reproduce:

1. Create a project with some files in it.
2. Open one of the files and close it. (not sure if this is necessary)
3. Close the project (not delete, just close).
4. In another project create a new folder, and in advanced options choose to
link in an external folder.  
5. Select the folder that contains the source in the project that was closed.
6. Select finish.
7. Resource.createLink() throws the exception below.

I cannot reproduce with these steps.  Can you reproduce with standard eclipse?
It looks like you're using a hacked up copy of the workbench - your stack trace
doesn't correspond to the provided steps.

Yes, I can reproduce it with a stock eclipse 3.0.  Although I didn't get a full
stack trace this time.
I'm attaching my .log and a screen shot.  

A note on the steps to reproduce:
In step 2, I added the source file to a foler in the project, not directly to
the project.

Ok, I was trying with the latest build.  This fails in 3.0 but does not fail in
the latest 3.1 stream build.

Are you satisfied that this is fixed in the 3.1 stream, or are you looking for a
fix in the 3.0 maintenance stream?
*** Bug 80452 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

A fix in 3.1 is fine for me.  It's not exactly the most common scenario.
Thanks
Pawel
Verified fix and added regression test case in 3.1 stream.
